alert.note: Alert for Durham; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:23PM EDT until May 21 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WAKE AND SOUTHEASTERN DURHAM COUNTIES... At 523 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near RDU International, or 7 miles southeast of Durham, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, RDU International, Morrisville, Research Triangle, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Gorman, William B Umstead State Park and Parkwood. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
